intro: Ancistrotropis firmula, commonly known as the small-flowered larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces spikes of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Ancistrotropis firmula is typically found in moist meadows and along stream banks.
